text: One morning , about a week after Bingley ’s engagement with Jane had been formed , as he and the females of the family were sitting together in the dining - room , their attention was suddenly drawn to the window by the sound of a carriage ; and they perceived a chaise and four driving up the lawn .
text_tokenized: One morning , about a week after Bingley ’s engagement with Jane had been formed , as he and the females of the family were sitting together in the dining - room , their attention was suddenly drawn to the window by the sound of a carriage ; and they perceived a chaise and four driving up the lawn .

text: It was too early in the morning for visitors ; and besides , the equipage did not answer to that of any of their neighbours .
text_tokenized: It was too early in the morning for visitors ; and besides , the equipage did not answer to that of any of their neighbours .

text: The horses were post ; and neither the carriage , nor the livery of the servant who preceded it , were familiar to them .
text_tokenized: The horses were post ; and neither the carriage , nor the livery of the servant who preceded it , were familiar to them .

text: As it was certain , however , that somebody was coming , Bingley instantly prevailed on Miss Bennet to avoid the confinement of such an intrusion , and walk away with him into the shrubbery .
text_tokenized: As it was certain , however , that somebody was coming , Bingley instantly prevailed on Miss Bennet to avoid the confinement of such an intrusion , and walk away with him into the shrubbery .

text: They both set off ; and the conjectures of the remaining three continued , though with little satisfaction , till the door was thrown open , and their visitor entered .
text_tokenized: They both set off ; and the conjectures of the remaining three continued , though with little satisfaction , till the door was thrown open , and their visitor entered .

text: It was Lady Catherine de Bourgh .
text_tokenized: It was Lady Catherine de Bourgh .

text: They were of course all intending to be surprised : but their astonishment was beyond their expectation ; and on the part of Mrs. Bennet and Kitty
text_tokenized: They were of course all intending to be surprised : but their astonishment was beyond their expectation ; and on the part of Mrs. Bennet and Kitty

text: , though she was perfectly unknown to them , even inferior to what Elizabeth felt
text_tokenized: , though she was perfectly unknown to them , even inferior to what Elizabeth felt

text: She entered the room with an air more than usually ungracious , made no other reply to Elizabeth ’s salutation than a slight inclination of the head , and sat down without saying a word .
text_tokenized: She entered the room with an air more than usually ungracious , made no other reply to Elizabeth ’s salutation than a slight inclination of the head , and sat down without saying a word .

text: Elizabeth
text_tokenized: Elizabeth

text: had mentioned her name to her mother on her Ladyship ’s entrance , though no request of introduction had been made .
text_tokenized: had mentioned her name to her mother on her Ladyship ’s entrance , though no request of introduction had been made .

text: Mrs. Bennet , all amazement , though flattered by having a guest of such high importance , received her with the utmost politeness .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet , all amazement , though flattered by having a guest of such high importance , received her with the utmost politeness .

text: After sitting for a moment in silence , she said , very stiffly , to Elizabeth,-- “ I hope you are well , Miss Bennet .
text_tokenized: After sitting for a moment in silence , she said , very stiffly , to Elizabeth,-- “ I hope you are well , Miss Bennet .

text: That lady , I suppose , is your mother ? ”
text_tokenized: That lady , I suppose , is your mother ? ”

text: Elizabeth replied very concisely that she was .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth replied very concisely that she was .

text: “ And _ that _ , I suppose , is one of your sisters ? ”
text_tokenized: “ And _ that _ , I suppose , is one of your sisters ? ”

text: “ Yes , madam , ” said Mrs. Bennet , delighted to speak to a Lady Catherine .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , madam , ” said Mrs. Bennet , delighted to speak to a Lady Catherine .

text: “ She is my youngest girl but one .
text_tokenized: “ She is my youngest girl but one .

text: My youngest of all is lately married , and my eldest is somewhere about the ground , walking with a young man , who , I believe , will soon become a part of the family . ” “ You have a very small park here , ” returned Lady Catherine , after a short silence .
text_tokenized: My youngest of all is lately married , and my eldest is somewhere about the ground , walking with a young man , who , I believe , will soon become a part of the family . ” “ You have a very small park here , ” returned Lady Catherine , after a short silence .

text: “ It is nothing in comparison of Rosings , my Lady , I dare say ; but , I assure you , it is much larger than Sir William Lucas ’s . ”
text_tokenized: “ It is nothing in comparison of Rosings , my Lady , I dare say ; but , I assure you , it is much larger than Sir William Lucas ’s . ”

text: “ This must be a most inconvenient sitting - room for the evening in summer : the windows are full west . ” Mrs. Bennet assured her that they never sat there after dinner ; and then added,-- “ May I take the liberty of asking your Ladyship whether you left Mr. and Mrs. Collins well ? ” “ Yes , very well .
text_tokenized: “ This must be a most inconvenient sitting - room for the evening in summer : the windows are full west . ” Mrs. Bennet assured her that they never sat there after dinner ; and then added,-- “ May I take the liberty of asking your Ladyship whether you left Mr. and Mrs. Collins well ? ” “ Yes , very well .

text: I saw them the night before last . ”
text_tokenized: I saw them the night before last . ”

text: Elizabeth now expected that she would produce a letter for her from Charlotte , as it seemed the only probable motive for her calling .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth now expected that she would produce a letter for her from Charlotte , as it seemed the only probable motive for her calling .

text: But no letter appeared , and she was completely puzzled .
text_tokenized: But no letter appeared , and she was completely puzzled .

text: Mrs. Bennet , with great civility , begged her Ladyship to take some refreshment : but Lady Catherine very resolutely , and not very politely ,
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet , with great civility , begged her Ladyship to take some refreshment : but Lady Catherine very resolutely , and not very politely ,

text: declined eating anything ; and then , rising up , said to Elizabeth,-- “ Miss Bennet , there seemed to be a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of your lawn .
text_tokenized: declined eating anything ; and then , rising up , said to Elizabeth,-- “ Miss Bennet , there seemed to be a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of your lawn .

text: I should be glad to take a turn in it , if you will favour me with your company . ”
text_tokenized: I should be glad to take a turn in it , if you will favour me with your company . ”

text: “ Go , my dear , ” cried her mother , “ and show her Ladyship about the different walks .
text_tokenized: “ Go , my dear , ” cried her mother , “ and show her Ladyship about the different walks .

text: I think she will be pleased with the hermitage . ” Elizabeth obeyed ; and , running into her own room for her parasol , attended her noble guest downstairs .
text_tokenized: I think she will be pleased with the hermitage . ” Elizabeth obeyed ; and , running into her own room for her parasol , attended her noble guest downstairs .

text: As they passed through the hall , Lady Catherine opened the doors into the dining - parlour and drawing - room , and pronouncing them , after a short survey , to be decent - looking rooms , walked on .
text_tokenized: As they passed through the hall , Lady Catherine opened the doors into the dining - parlour and drawing - room , and pronouncing them , after a short survey , to be decent - looking rooms , walked on .

text: Her carriage remained at the door , and Elizabeth saw that her waiting - woman was in it .
text_tokenized: Her carriage remained at the door , and Elizabeth saw that her waiting - woman was in it .

text: They proceeded in silence along the gravel walk that led to the copse ; Elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable .
text_tokenized: They proceeded in silence along the gravel walk that led to the copse ; Elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable .

text: “ How could I ever think her like her nephew ? ” said she , as she looked in her face .
text_tokenized: “ How could I ever think her like her nephew ? ” said she , as she looked in her face .

text: As soon as they entered the copse , Lady Catherine began in the following manner:-- “ You can be at no loss , Miss Bennet , to understand the reason of my journey hither .
text_tokenized: As soon as they entered the copse , Lady Catherine began in the following manner:-- “ You can be at no loss , Miss Bennet , to understand the reason of my journey hither .

text: Your own heart , your own conscience , must tell you why I come . ”
text_tokenized: Your own heart , your own conscience , must tell you why I come . ”

text: Elizabeth looked with unaffected astonishment . “ Indeed , you are mistaken , madam ; I have not been at all able to account for the honour of seeing you here . ”
text_tokenized: Elizabeth looked with unaffected astonishment . “ Indeed , you are mistaken , madam ; I have not been at all able to account for the honour of seeing you here . ”

text: “ Miss Bennet , ” replied her Ladyship , in an angry tone , “ you ought to know that I am not to be trifled with .
text_tokenized: “ Miss Bennet , ” replied her Ladyship , in an angry tone , “ you ought to know that I am not to be trifled with .

text: But however insincere _ you _ may choose to be , you shall not find _ me _ so .
text_tokenized: But however insincere _ you _ may choose to be , you shall not find _ me _ so .

text: My character has ever been
text_tokenized: My character has ever been

text: celebrated for its sincerity and frankness ; and in a cause of such moment as this , I shall certainly not depart from it .
text_tokenized: celebrated for its sincerity and frankness ; and in a cause of such moment as this , I shall certainly not depart from it .

text: A report of a most alarming nature reached me two days ago .
text_tokenized: A report of a most alarming nature reached me two days ago .

text: I was told , that not only your sister was on the point of being most advantageously married , but that _ you_--that Miss Elizabeth Bennet would , in all likelihood , be soon afterwards united to my nephew -- my own nephew , Mr. Darcy .
text_tokenized: I was told , that not only your sister was on the point of being most advantageously married , but that _ you_--that Miss Elizabeth Bennet would , in all likelihood , be soon afterwards united to my nephew -- my own nephew , Mr. Darcy .

text: Though I _ know _ it must be a scandalous falsehood , though I would not injure him so much as to suppose the truth of it possible , I instantly resolved on setting off for this place , that I might make my sentiments known to you . ”
text_tokenized: Though I _ know _ it must be a scandalous falsehood , though I would not injure him so much as to suppose the truth of it possible , I instantly resolved on setting off for this place , that I might make my sentiments known to you . ”

text: “ If you believed it impossible to be true , ” said Elizabeth , colouring with astonishment and disdain , “ I wonder you took the trouble of coming so far .
text_tokenized: “ If you believed it impossible to be true , ” said Elizabeth , colouring with astonishment and disdain , “ I wonder you took the trouble of coming so far .

text: What could your Ladyship propose by it ? ”
text_tokenized: What could your Ladyship propose by it ? ”

text: “ At once to insist upon having such a report universally contradicted . ”
text_tokenized: “ At once to insist upon having such a report universally contradicted . ”

text: “ Your coming to Longbourn , to see me and my family , ” said Elizabeth coolly , “ will be rather a confirmation of it -- if , indeed , such a report is in existence . ”
text_tokenized: “ Your coming to Longbourn , to see me and my family , ” said Elizabeth coolly , “ will be rather a confirmation of it -- if , indeed , such a report is in existence . ”

text: “ If !
text_tokenized: “ If !

text: do you then pretend to be ignorant of it ?
text_tokenized: do you then pretend to be ignorant of it ?

text: Has it not been industriously circulated by yourselves ?
text_tokenized: Has it not been industriously circulated by yourselves ?

text: Do you not know that such a report is spread abroad ? ”
text_tokenized: Do you not know that such a report is spread abroad ? ”

text: “ I never heard that it was . ” “ And can you likewise declare , that there is no _ foundation _ for it ? ”
text_tokenized: “ I never heard that it was . ” “ And can you likewise declare , that there is no _ foundation _ for it ? ”

text: “ I do not pretend to possess equal frankness with your Ladyship .
text_tokenized: “ I do not pretend to possess equal frankness with your Ladyship .

text: _ You _ may ask questions which _ I _ shall not choose to answer . ”
text_tokenized: _ You _ may ask questions which _ I _ shall not choose to answer . ”

text: “ This is not to be borne .
text_tokenized: “ This is not to be borne .

text: Miss Bennet , I insist on being satisfied .
text_tokenized: Miss Bennet , I insist on being satisfied .

text: Has he , has my nephew , made you an offer of marriage ? ”
text_tokenized: Has he , has my nephew , made you an offer of marriage ? ”

text: “ Your Ladyship has declared it to be impossible . ” “ It ought to be so ; it must be so , while he retains the use of his reason .
text_tokenized: “ Your Ladyship has declared it to be impossible . ” “ It ought to be so ; it must be so , while he retains the use of his reason .

text: But _ your _ arts and allurements may , in a moment of infatuation , have made him forget what he owes to himself and to all his family .
text_tokenized: But _ your _ arts and allurements may , in a moment of infatuation , have made him forget what he owes to himself and to all his family .

text: You may have drawn him in . ”
text_tokenized: You may have drawn him in . ”

text: “ If I have , I shall be the last person to confess it . ” “ Miss Bennet , do you know who I am ?
text_tokenized: “ If I have , I shall be the last person to confess it . ” “ Miss Bennet , do you know who I am ?

text: I have not been accustomed to such language as this .
text_tokenized: I have not been accustomed to such language as this .

text: I am almost the nearest relation he has in the world , and am entitled to know all his dearest concerns .
text_tokenized: I am almost the nearest relation he has in the world , and am entitled to know all his dearest concerns .

text: “ But you are not entitled to know _ mine _ ; nor will such behaviour as this ever induce me to be explicit . ”
text_tokenized: “ But you are not entitled to know _ mine _ ; nor will such behaviour as this ever induce me to be explicit . ”

text: “ Let me be rightly understood .
text_tokenized: “ Let me be rightly understood .

text: This match , to which you have the presumption to aspire , can never take place .
text_tokenized: This match , to which you have the presumption to aspire , can never take place .

text: No , never .
text_tokenized: No , never .

text: Mr. Darcy is engaged to _ my daughter _ .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy is engaged to _ my daughter _ .

text: Now , what have you to say ?
text_tokenized: Now , what have you to say ?

text: ” “ Only this,--that if he is so , you can have no reason to suppose he will make an offer to me
text_tokenized: ” “ Only this,--that if he is so , you can have no reason to suppose he will make an offer to me

text: Lady Catherine hesitated for a moment , and then replied,-- “ The engagement between them is of a peculiar kind .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine hesitated for a moment , and then replied,-- “ The engagement between them is of a peculiar kind .

text: From their infancy , they have been intended for each other .
text_tokenized: From their infancy , they have been intended for each other .

text: It was the favourite wish of _ his _ mother , as well as of hers .
text_tokenized: It was the favourite wish of _ his _ mother , as well as of hers .

text: While in their cradles we planned the union ; and now , at the moment when the wishes of both sisters would be accomplished , is their marriage to be prevented by a young woman of inferior birth , of no importance in the world , and wholly unallied to the family ? Do you pay no regard to the wishes of his friends -- to his tacit engagement with Miss de Bourgh ?
text_tokenized: While in their cradles we planned the union ; and now , at the moment when the wishes of both sisters would be accomplished , is their marriage to be prevented by a young woman of inferior birth , of no importance in the world , and wholly unallied to the family ? Do you pay no regard to the wishes of his friends -- to his tacit engagement with Miss de Bourgh ?

text: Are you lost to every feeling of propriety and delicacy ?
text_tokenized: Are you lost to every feeling of propriety and delicacy ?

text: Have you not heard me say , that from his earliest hours he was destined for his cousin ? ” “ Yes ; and I had heard it before .
text_tokenized: Have you not heard me say , that from his earliest hours he was destined for his cousin ? ” “ Yes ; and I had heard it before .

text: But what is that to me ?
text_tokenized: But what is that to me ?

text: If there is no other objection to my marrying your nephew , I shall certainly not be kept from it by knowing that his mother and aunt wished him to marry Miss de Bourgh .
text_tokenized: If there is no other objection to my marrying your nephew , I shall certainly not be kept from it by knowing that his mother and aunt wished him to marry Miss de Bourgh .

text: You both did as much as you could in planning the marriage .
text_tokenized: You both did as much as you could in planning the marriage .

text: Its completion depended on others .
text_tokenized: Its completion depended on others .

text: If Mr. Darcy is neither by honour nor inclination confined to his cousin , why is not he to make another choice ?
text_tokenized: If Mr. Darcy is neither by honour nor inclination confined to his cousin , why is not he to make another choice ?

text: And if I am that choice , why may not I accept him ?
text_tokenized: And if I am that choice , why may not I accept him ?

text: “ Because honour , decorum , prudence -- nay , interest -- forbid it .
text_tokenized: “ Because honour , decorum , prudence -- nay , interest -- forbid it .

text: Yes , Miss Bennet , interest ; for do not expect to be noticed by his family or friends , if you wilfully act against the inclinations of all .
text_tokenized: Yes , Miss Bennet , interest ; for do not expect to be noticed by his family or friends , if you wilfully act against the inclinations of all .

text: You will
text_tokenized: You will

text: be censured , slighted , and despised , by everyone connected with him .
text_tokenized: be censured , slighted , and despised , by everyone connected with him .

text: Your alliance will be a disgrace ; your name will never even be mentioned by any of us . ”
text_tokenized: Your alliance will be a disgrace ; your name will never even be mentioned by any of us . ”

text: “ These are heavy misfortunes , ” replied Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ These are heavy misfortunes , ” replied Elizabeth .

text: “ But the wife of Mr. Darcy
text_tokenized: “ But the wife of Mr. Darcy

text: must have such extraordinary sources of happiness necessarily attached to her situation , that she could , upon the whole , have no cause to repine . ”
text_tokenized: must have such extraordinary sources of happiness necessarily attached to her situation , that she could , upon the whole , have no cause to repine . ”

text: “ Obstinate , headstrong girl !
text_tokenized: “ Obstinate , headstrong girl !

text: I am ashamed of you !
text_tokenized: I am ashamed of you !

text: Is this your gratitude for my attentions to you last spring ?
text_tokenized: Is this your gratitude for my attentions to you last spring ?

text: Is nothing due to me on that score ?
text_tokenized: Is nothing due to me on that score ?

text: Let us sit down .
text_tokenized: Let us sit down .

text: You are to understand , Miss Bennet , that I came here with the determined resolution of carrying my purpose ; nor will I be dissuaded from it .
text_tokenized: You are to understand , Miss Bennet , that I came here with the determined resolution of carrying my purpose ; nor will I be dissuaded from it .

text: I have not been used to submit to any person ’s whims .
text_tokenized: I have not been used to submit to any person ’s whims .

text: I have not been in the habit of brooking disappointment .
text_tokenized: I have not been in the habit of brooking disappointment .

text: ” “ _ That _ will make your Ladyship ’s situation at present more pitiable ; but it will have no effect on _ me _ . ”
text_tokenized: ” “ _ That _ will make your Ladyship ’s situation at present more pitiable ; but it will have no effect on _ me _ . ”

text: “ I will not be interrupted !
text_tokenized: “ I will not be interrupted !

text: Hear me in silence .
text_tokenized: Hear me in silence .

text: My daughter and my nephew are formed for each other .
text_tokenized: My daughter and my nephew are formed for each other .

text: They are descended , on the maternal side , from the same noble line ; and , on the father ’s , from respectable , honourable , and ancient , though untitled , families .
text_tokenized: They are descended , on the maternal side , from the same noble line ; and , on the father ’s , from respectable , honourable , and ancient , though untitled , families .

text: Their fortune on both sides
text_tokenized: Their fortune on both sides

text: is splendid .
text_tokenized: is splendid .

text: They are destined for each other by the voice of every member of their respective houses ; and what is to divide them?--the upstart pretensions of a young woman without family , connections , or fortune !
text_tokenized: They are destined for each other by the voice of every member of their respective houses ; and what is to divide them?--the upstart pretensions of a young woman without family , connections , or fortune !

text: Is this to be endured ?
text_tokenized: Is this to be endured ?

text: But it must not , shall not be !
text_tokenized: But it must not , shall not be !

text: If you were sensible of your own good , you would not wish to quit the sphere in which you have been brought up . ”
text_tokenized: If you were sensible of your own good , you would not wish to quit the sphere in which you have been brought up . ”

text: “ In marrying your nephew , I should not consider myself as quitting that sphere .
text_tokenized: “ In marrying your nephew , I should not consider myself as quitting that sphere .

text: He is a gentleman ; I am a gentleman ’s daughter ; so far we are equal . ”
text_tokenized: He is a gentleman ; I am a gentleman ’s daughter ; so far we are equal . ”

text: “ True .
text_tokenized: “ True .

text: You _ are _ a gentleman ’s daughter .
text_tokenized: You _ are _ a gentleman ’s daughter .

text: But what was your mother ?
text_tokenized: But what was your mother ?

text: Who are your uncles and aunts ?
text_tokenized: Who are your uncles and aunts ?

text: Do not imagine me ignorant of their condition . ”
text_tokenized: Do not imagine me ignorant of their condition . ”

text: “ Whatever my connections may be , ” said Elizabeth , “ if your nephew does not object to them , they can be nothing to _ you _ . ”
text_tokenized: “ Whatever my connections may be , ” said Elizabeth , “ if your nephew does not object to them , they can be nothing to _ you _ . ”

text: “ Tell me , once for all , are you engaged to him ? ” Though Elizabeth would not , for the mere purpose of obliging Lady Catherine , have answered this question , she could not but say , after a moment ’s deliberation,-- “ I am not . ”
text_tokenized: “ Tell me , once for all , are you engaged to him ? ” Though Elizabeth would not , for the mere purpose of obliging Lady Catherine , have answered this question , she could not but say , after a moment ’s deliberation,-- “ I am not . ”

text: Lady Catherine seemed pleased .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine seemed pleased .

text: “ And will you promise me never to enter into such an engagement ? ” “ I will make no promise of the kind . ”
text_tokenized: “ And will you promise me never to enter into such an engagement ? ” “ I will make no promise of the kind . ”

text: “ Miss Bennet , I am shocked and astonished .
text_tokenized: “ Miss Bennet , I am shocked and astonished .

text: I expected to find a more reasonable young woman .
text_tokenized: I expected to find a more reasonable young woman .

text: But do not deceive yourself into a belief that I will ever recede .
text_tokenized: But do not deceive yourself into a belief that I will ever recede .

text: I shall not go away till you have given me the assurance I require . ” “ And I certainly _ never _ shall give it .
text_tokenized: I shall not go away till you have given me the assurance I require . ” “ And I certainly _ never _ shall give it .

text: I am not to be intimidated into anything so wholly unreasonable .
text_tokenized: I am not to be intimidated into anything so wholly unreasonable .

text: Your Ladyship wants Mr. Darcy to marry your daughter ; but would my giving you the wished - for promise make _ their _ marriage at all more probable ?
text_tokenized: Your Ladyship wants Mr. Darcy to marry your daughter ; but would my giving you the wished - for promise make _ their _ marriage at all more probable ?

text: Supposing him to be attached to me , would _ my _ refusing to accept his hand make him wish to bestow it on his cousin ?
text_tokenized: Supposing him to be attached to me , would _ my _ refusing to accept his hand make him wish to bestow it on his cousin ?

text: Allow me to say , Lady Catherine , that the arguments with which you have supported this extraordinary application have been as frivolous as the application was ill - judged .
text_tokenized: Allow me to say , Lady Catherine , that the arguments with which you have supported this extraordinary application have been as frivolous as the application was ill - judged .

text: You have widely mistaken my character , if you think I can be worked on by such persuasions as these .
text_tokenized: You have widely mistaken my character , if you think I can be worked on by such persuasions as these .

text: How far your nephew might approve of your interference in _ his _ affairs , I can not tell ; but you have certainly no right to concern yourself in mine .
text_tokenized: How far your nephew might approve of your interference in _ his _ affairs , I can not tell ; but you have certainly no right to concern yourself in mine .

text: I must beg , therefore , to be importuned no further on the subject . ” “ Not so hasty , if you please . I have by no means done .
text_tokenized: I must beg , therefore , to be importuned no further on the subject . ” “ Not so hasty , if you please . I have by no means done .

text: To all the objections I have already urged I have still another to add .
text_tokenized: To all the objections I have already urged I have still another to add .

text: I am no stranger to the particulars of your youngest sister ’s infamous elopement .
text_tokenized: I am no stranger to the particulars of your youngest sister ’s infamous elopement .

text: I know it all ; that the young man ’s marrying her was a patched - up business , at the expense of your father and uncle .
text_tokenized: I know it all ; that the young man ’s marrying her was a patched - up business , at the expense of your father and uncle .

text: And is _ such _ a girl to be my nephew ’s sister ?
text_tokenized: And is _ such _ a girl to be my nephew ’s sister ?

text: Is _ her _ husband , who is the son of his late father ’s steward , to be his brother ?
text_tokenized: Is _ her _ husband , who is the son of his late father ’s steward , to be his brother ?

text: Heaven and earth!--of what are you thinking ?
text_tokenized: Heaven and earth!--of what are you thinking ?

text: Are the shades of Pemberley to be thus polluted ?
text_tokenized: Are the shades of Pemberley to be thus polluted ?

text: “ You can _ now _ have nothing further to say , ” she resentfully answered .
text_tokenized: “ You can _ now _ have nothing further to say , ” she resentfully answered .

text: “ You have insulted me , in every possible method .
text_tokenized: “ You have insulted me , in every possible method .

text: I must beg to return to the house . ” And she rose as she spoke .
text_tokenized: I must beg to return to the house . ” And she rose as she spoke .

text: Lady Catherine rose also , and they turned back .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine rose also , and they turned back .

text: Her Ladyship was highly incensed .
text_tokenized: Her Ladyship was highly incensed .

text: “ You have no regard , then , for the honour and credit of my nephew !
text_tokenized: “ You have no regard , then , for the honour and credit of my nephew !

text: Unfeeling , selfish girl ! Do you not consider that a connection with you must disgrace him in the eyes of everybody ? ”
text_tokenized: Unfeeling , selfish girl ! Do you not consider that a connection with you must disgrace him in the eyes of everybody ? ”

text: “ Lady Catherine , I have nothing further to say .
text_tokenized: “ Lady Catherine , I have nothing further to say .

text: You know my sentiments . ”
text_tokenized: You know my sentiments . ”

text: “ You are then resolved to have him ? ”
text_tokenized: “ You are then resolved to have him ? ”

text: “ I have said no such thing .
text_tokenized: “ I have said no such thing .

text: I am only resolved to act in that manner , which will , in my own opinion , constitute my happiness , without reference to _ you _ , or to any person so wholly unconnected with me . ”
text_tokenized: I am only resolved to act in that manner , which will , in my own opinion , constitute my happiness , without reference to _ you _ , or to any person so wholly unconnected with me . ”

text: “ It is well .
text_tokenized: “ It is well .

text: You refuse , then , to oblige me .
text_tokenized: You refuse , then , to oblige me .

text: You refuse to obey the claims of duty , honour , and gratitude .
text_tokenized: You refuse to obey the claims of duty , honour , and gratitude .

text: You are determined to ruin him in the opinion of all his friends , and make him the contempt of the world . ”
text_tokenized: You are determined to ruin him in the opinion of all his friends , and make him the contempt of the world . ”

text: “ Neither duty , nor honour , nor gratitude , ” replied Elizabeth , “ has any possible claim on me , in the present instance .
text_tokenized: “ Neither duty , nor honour , nor gratitude , ” replied Elizabeth , “ has any possible claim on me , in the present instance .

text: No principle of either would be violated by my marriage with Mr. Darcy .

text: If he is satisfied with only regretting me , when he might have obtained my affections and hand , I shall soon cease to regret him at all . ” The surprise of the rest of the family , on hearing who their visitor had been , was very great : but they obligingly satisfied it with the same kind of supposition which had appeased Mrs. Bennet ’s curiosity ; and Elizabeth was spared from much teasing on the subject . The next morning , as she was going down stairs , she was met by her father , who came out of his library with a letter in his hand .
